author: Bill A

text:
You are welcome!
Capcom will realize their errors when it will be too late for them.
Being a long time fan of Megaman, Devil May Cry, Final Fantasy, Castlevania, Silent Hill, i'm full od sadness for the way Japan is facing the "crisis".
If mediocre to horrible titles like DmC, Final Fantasy XIII-2, Silent Hill Downpour are Japan's answer, i'm afraid to know the question :S
author: BrokenYamato

text:
Indeed, my friend, indeed.
As an all time fan since Mundus, Trish and Dante united for an awful voice acting, I can't agree more about Ninja Theory being one huge of a shitty producer AND Capcom really killing it's own awesome series.
Seriously... Does everybody in Street Fighter IV take body building pills as their morning breakfast? And why the hell is Resident Evil 5 an action game?
author: EmptyKingdoms

text:
If I could ever thank you for saying everything I have noticed (a few added information, actually), so far... THANK. YOU. BROKEN. YAMATO. NOW I KNOW WHY YOU'RE BROKEN, PRETTY AWESOME SWORD! (I'd rather consider Yamato a Kodachi than a Katana, considering it's size on both DMC3SE and DMC4, but anyways...)
Thanks for being SO sincere and bringing the utmost truth of a failed enterprise that wants recognition and money no matter what (not to mention how much Capcom's failing hard recently).
author: EmptyKingdoms

text: Thank you :)
author: BrokenYamato

text: You speak so much truth. I applaud your insightfulness man.
author: Providence

text:
If you have been following Ninja Theory at all, you should know why fans are pissed. They are hypocratical in thinking that they have good writing skills, they still struggle with coding a game after making three action-based titles, they have removed any SSSensational skill with obtaining large comboes and let's not get started with the FUCK YOU.

Capcom has become complacent with their franchises, and along with the plenty other messes QA are forced to endorse, it shows.

text:
7) to troll the old fans and creating a video in wich the new "Dante" find a white wing and say "not even in a million years" disgusted (just to troll a little more).

author: BrokenYamato

text: 6) prevent frame rate drops (they are there anyways); and on top of that, the head of NT calling all the DMC fans SHEEPS, calling the old Dante a freak, bashing the old series, comparing himself to Nolan and his Dante to the new James Bond (...), insulting Kamiya (the creator of the original Dante)'s Bayonetta (game) just to bad-copy it in the next trailer; insulted Naughty Dog for "overdoing" the animations in Uncharted (bah...) ; inserting in a trailer a rusty car with a "DMC 5" plate just
author: BrokenYamato

text: 5) blonde human but a brunette angel (sigh); Dante is half demon-half angel; the gameplay is broken to no limit (just to mention one thing, there is no more the aim lock button: some moves require to push the analog twice in one direction and press attack, wich means bye bye joystick after 2 hours of play; no more taunt buttton; joypad layout completely changed and messed; slower gameplay;  unchallanging ranking system (it deacreases if, and only if, you get hit); fewer enemies on screen (to
author: BrokenYamato

text: 4) DmC: is not even out yet, and still one can see how much of a disaster it is to the former series; the main character is basically a jerk wich say "fuck you" every 2 seconds (really, look at ALL the trailers); Vergil is now a mixture between Batman (rich guy fighting evil) and Ken doll from Barbie (look at the face); rebellion is now a tootpick; ebony & ivory are banana-like guns; Mundus is a fat bold idiot; we have a character (Kat) wich uses MAGICAL PAINT (...), Eva is no longer a
author: BrokenYamato

text: 3) repeat the same 2 combos for the whole game; from the so called "master of storytelling", they created a story so full of plotholes that you may cry; framerate drops; hilarious bugs; a game extremely short (like HS); extra easy difficulty (auto jumps; no chance of death by fall; shiny objects to show you the road; co-character wich show you, at the beginning of each stage, the full stage from an aerial pow; the game flopped hard, and NT pubblically blamed Namco (the producer) and DMC fans...
author: BrokenYamato

text:
2) As if they have some kind of handicap (not being "funny": they really do; look at the son of the villain...); the gameplay was broken as hell, huge loads of glitches and bugs, game freezing, fps drops, and the audio level of the dialogues where 50% lower than fx (with no chance of customization). the game flopped hard even with sony expanding the original NT team with 100 (yes, 100) new employees. NT pubblically blamed Sony for the poor sales.

-Enslaved: here again, a game that's a mess; you
author: BrokenYamato

text: Well... the direction the series is going... I honestly dont like it. The combat was AWESOME as always, its just that it is not Devil may cry. text: I felt that Nero was overpowered and had the advantage because of his arm grab stuff. When I got to Dante I just wanted to play as Nero again because of Yamato and the grab mechanics. Dante's weapons were awesome and I love the character but I didn't feel like he was overpowered.

author: Tree Man

text: Vergil looks like a pussy in the DMC reboot

DMC4 is a decent game, though nowhere near as good as 3 or 1.  Nero was surprisingly fun to play as, but the Dante section (between the backtracking and Dante being ridiculously overpowered) kind of puts a damper on the overall game.  Bayonetta, even if the heroine isn't the greatest, is a much better game that's still very DMC-esque (same creator).
author: tallwhiteninja

text:
DMC>DMC3>DMC2>DMC4

I've finished all of them, and that's what I think. Nothing tops the feeling of exploring that eerie castle in DMC 1, but holy shit was DMC 3 insanely cool, even though some parts (guitar weapon lol) were trying too hard.

text: I don't think they'll slip in the gameplay mechanics or any of the "program" part, but the story seems so disappointing, they've sucked out all the soul the game had. Dante turned out into a teenage in and out (dropping fucks and shits like a 14-years old). Can't say much about vergil with the little that they showed, but he seemed so "idealistic" and "good-willing", much different from the original cocky and cold. His clothes are pretty nice though. Prolly will be: a good game, not a good DMC.

text: I'm usually not a big fan of this kind of music, but with this series it simply works too well. It﻿ makes your heart pump while you're fighting hordes of﻿ monsters with the awesome combat system. I haven't played DMC4 yet, I saw it super cheap. I'm very curious about the DMC reboot, it seems like they made some strange decisions (starting with Dante's teenage look). But I have faith in Ninja Theory.
